text:
Dear Apache.org,

I've been using apache server on linux as well as on windows for several years.
I've just installed a new copy of the Apache http 2.0.47 to the windows xp 
(with SP2).

The problem is that this version of apache can't open the jpeg files. Gif and 
other formats are OK. Jpeg doesn't work. I tried to install the 1.3.26 and it 
works fine.

for example if I put an jpeg image to htdocs, it doesn't open it.
http://localhost/image.jpg doesn't work.
http://localhost/image.gif, png, everything else works.

System config:

Windows XP SP2
Athlon XP 2200 +
512 mb ram

Sincerely,
Tomas Selnekovic
creator: tomas@runway.sk
erik@codefaktor.de
text:
Hmm, perhaps there is a problem with your mime-type settings or even a broken JPEG file but I'm 
pretty sure that JPEGs are working fine with 2.0.47 on XP; otherwise there would be much more 
bug-reports :)

You can try to trace the HTTP headers and see if there are any indicators of what's going on. 
Perhaps it also helps to disable the sendfile support (EnableSendfile Off) and to make sure that the 
files are not served off of a networked filesystem like NFS or SMB. Another possibility could be 
mod_mime_magic, try to disable it if it is enabled. Ahh, and btw, don't forget to have look in the 
error log...

I'm marking this bug as invalid now, but please feel free to re-open it if you can come up with 
some more information and after experimenting with the suggestions above.
